summary: Email exchange between FBI personnel and a US Attorney's Office representative regarding the transfer of four forensic drives from the FBI's NY CART team to the Southern District of New York, with the meeting arranged at St. Andrew's Church.

connections.description: Coordinating the handoff of forensic evidence (drives) from the FBI to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
Both are FBI personnel involved in the evidence transfer process, with M being copied on the email exchange.

events.title: Forensic drive transfer arranged
events.description: FBI forensic examiner I. arranges to meet a US Attorney's Office representative near St. Andrew's Church to hand over four forensic drives for the Southern District of New York.

locations: St. Andrew's Church (likely in New York, referenced as meeting location)
Southern District of New York (referenced as destination for drives)
keyFacts: Four forensic drives were prepared by the FBI's NY CART team for transfer to the Southern District of New York on October 15, 2020.
The handoff was arranged to occur near St. Andrew's Church, with a US Attorney's Office representative present inside the church.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), indicating restricted access to its contents.
